intro: Pseudodrimys stipitata, commonly known as the Chilean wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, wax-like leaves. The plant typically grows as a tall tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a unique, fragrant aroma. Pseudodrimys stipitata is well adapted to the coastal and mountainous environments of its native habitat.
